solution_line_template: First, we need to find out which fruit is cheaper individually. We start by figuring out the price for a single apple by performing {total_cost_apples_cents}/{num_apples}= <<{total_cost_apples_cents}/{num_apples}={price_per_apple_cents}>>{price_per_apple_cents} cents per apple.

Then we find out the price of an individual orange, by performing {total_cost_oranges_cents}/{num_oranges}=<<{total_cost_oranges_cents}/{num_oranges}={price_per_orange_cents}>>{price_per_orange_cents} cents per orange.
To determine the answer, we multiply {price_per_apple_cents}*{quantity_to_buy}= <<{price_per_apple_cents}*{quantity_to_buy}={total_cost_cheaper_fruit_cents}>>{total_cost_cheaper_fruit_cents} cents
